book-beasts.short: Book Beasts is a web application designed for students to create and share their own custom story books. It also includes an extensive interface that provides instructors with the tools necessary to manage their students and keep track of their progress.
full: For our final project at Fullstack Academy, my team and I wanted to build an educational and interactive experience — so we built Book Beasts. This project had two main goals: the first was to enable students’ creativity by giving them a platform to create, and the second was to provide instructors with the tools necessary to monitor and manage their students’ works.

I was responsible for the interface through which students create and edit their own books, as well as the database structure that supports it. Due to the complex nature of our relational database, I also wrote a great deal of tests to ensure that the books and pages worked as intended as we made changes throughout the project. This experience helped me understand how valuable test-driven development can be, even when on a short schedule.

Built in roughly 10 days, Umami Meats is an ecommerce site that sells a small variety of quality meat and fish. The vast majority of my time on this project was spent designing and building the frontend. At the very beginning of the project, I drew the wireframes for nearly every page; these proved to be invaluable, as they greatly sped up our process and ensured visual consistency throughout the entire application. Once we had built the foundation for each page, I revised much of the styling and added subtle animations to construct a user experience that is both aesthetically pleasing and extremely clear.
umami-meats.short: Umami Meats is an ecommerce site where users can view and buy various types of high-end steak and sushi.

solar-sandbox.short: Solar Sandbox is an interactive application where users can design their own solar system from scratch. Build a network of planets and moons and watch the 3D view update in realtime!
contributions: In progress: Ability for users to share their creation
full: As someone who loves to watch and study the stars, I have always imagined what it would be like to toy with the vast systems that contain our tiny planet. Solar Sandbox is a small, fun project that provides the ability to do so. Users can add planets to orbit their sun, and they can add moons to orbit their planets. Additionally, they can alter various parameters on the bodies in their solar system, such as size, color, orbit distance, and orbit speed.

This project was built in about 4 days for ‘Async Week’ during my time at Fullstack Academy. When I occasionally have time, I enjoy returning to this project to make small tweaks, such as bug fixes and UI/UX improvements.
